Detailed Description

We want the output to be the same as the perl code, so //! we have converted the code to C. Refer to the perldocs //! for more info.

These used to live in stats-distributions.cpp, but are now templates //! so we get the float and double versions.

Typedef Documentation

typedef enum affxstat::_TAIL_TYPE affxstat::TAIL_TYPE

Tail types for statistical tests.

Enumeration Type Documentation

enum affxstat::_TAIL_TYPE

Tail types for statistical tests.

Enumerator:
ONE_SIDED_LOWER 

One sided lower tail

ONE_SIDED_UPPER 

Once sided upper tail

TWO_SIDED 

Two sided tail

double affxstat::ranksumTest ( double *  x1,
int  n1,
double *  x2,
int  n2,
int  tail_type,
bool  log_p 
)

Performs a Wilcoxon rank sum test. This is the simplest interface.

Parameters:
x1 The array of values for the first sample.
n1 The number of points in the x1 array.
x2 The array of values for the second sample.
n2 The number of points in the x2 array.
tail_type The tail type for the test (one of ONE_SIDED_UPPER, ONE_SIDED_LOWER, TWO_SIDED)
log_p Boolean flag indicating if the p-value should be logged.
Returns:
The computed p-value.

void affxstat::ranksumTest ( double *  x1,
int  n1,
double *  x2,
int  n2,
int *  nTied,
double *  pval,
double *  signal,
int  tail_type 
)

Performs a Wilcoxon rank sum test. This is the legacy interface.

Parameters:
x1 The array of values for the first sample.
n1 The number of points in the x1 array.
x2 The array of values for the second sample.
n2 The number of points in the x2 array.
nTied Value will be incremented by one if there were ties in the input data.
pval The computed p-value.
signal The median of all pairwise differences in x1 and x2 (Hodges-Lehmann estimator)
tail_type The tail type for the test (one of ONE_SIDED_UPPER, ONE_SIDED_LOWER, TWO_SIDED)

bool *  tied,
double *  pval,
int  tail_type,
bool  log_p 
)

Performs a Wilcoxon rank sum test. This is the full interface.

Parameters:
x1 The array of values for the first sample.
n1 The number of points in the x1 array.
x2 The array of values for the second sample.
n2 The number of points in the x2 array.
tied Boolean flag, value will reflect whether or not there were ties in the input data.
pval The computed p-value.
tail_type The tail type for the test (one of ONE_SIDED_UPPER, ONE_SIDED_LOWER, TWO_SIDED)
log_p Boolean flag indicating if the p-value should be logged.

int  n,
int *  tied,
int *  nZero,
int *  tiedAndZero,
double *  pval,
double *  signal 
)

Performs a signed rank test, returns logged lower-tail p-value and computes pseudoMedian. This is the legacy interface.

Parameters:
x The array of values to analyze.
n The number of points in the x array.
tied The number of observations that were tied.
nZero The number of observations that were zero.
tiedAndZero The number of observations that were tied and zero.
pval The p-value.
signal The pseudo median.
